--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, chirag chauhan
<chirag_299@y...> wrote:
> 
>  
> So, plz tell us that where this code we will put in HERITRIX source code


There's a bunch of ways to do this.  One way would be to register a
new logger -- study how loggers are registered here
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/framework/CrawlController.html#707
-- and then call your new logger in same place crawl.log is called
(See AbstractFrontier#log) -- or you could change the crawl.log logger
to write two places.

The easiest way to do this though is not to change the code at all. 
Pipe your crawl.log through awk:

% cat crawl.log |awk '{print $4}'

This will output the 4th column of the crawl.log,  the URLs crawled.
St.Ack


.
> If we are making any mistake then tell us or if u have the code to
create the .TXT file which contain the crawled URIs then reply soon.We
hope this kind of help.
